attributes.action: compel HMRC to provide a free credit report to all victims of the November 2007 data loss in Dec 07 and May 08
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
Note:  This web site claims this is a duplicate of the HMRCblunder petition but that petition does not appear in the site's search facility or the relevant category so I have created this petition.

Following the loss of millions of child benefit clamants' details by HMRC there is a risk that innocent people may become the victims of identity theft.  Fraudsters may apply for credit in the name of these victims, leading to their credit record being blighted.  If a victim does not apply for any credit in the next year then they may not realise that this has happened.  We would ask HMRC to provide a free credit report for every affected person both six months after the event (May 2008) and 12 months after the event (November 2008) so that anyone who has suffered fraud is alerted.

rejection.details: As indicated previously. "HMRC credit" is an adequate search term.
reasons: Duplicate - this is similar to and/or overlaps with an existing petition or petitions
